title:
Transition temperature of homogeneous weakly interacting Bose gas in
  self-consistent Popov approximation
authors: Pham Duy Thanh, Nguyen Van Thu and Lo Thi Thuy
abstract:
Using the Cornwall-Jackiw-Tomboulis effective action framework in conjunction
with variational perturbation theory, this study investigates the relative
shift in the transition temperature of a homogeneous repulsive weakly
interacting Bose gas compared to that of an ideal Bose gas. Employing both
one-loop and self-consistent Popov approximations, we derive the universal form
of the relative shift in the transition temperature, which is proportional to
the s-wave scattering length. The results demonstrate excellent agreement with
those obtained through precise Monte Carlo simulations. Furthermore, the
zero-point energy and various thermodynamic quantities are also analyzed in the
condensed phase.
